info.title: NetworkManager Plugin
info.description: A Unified `NetworkManager` plugin that allows you to manage Ethernet and Wifi interfaces on the device.

interface.summary: An interface, such as `eth0` or `wlan0`, depending upon availability of the given interface

autoconfig.summary: `true` if DHCP is used, `false` if IP is configured manually

endpoint.summary: The host name or IP address

noOfRequest.summary: The number of packets to send. Default is 15.

frequency.summary: The supported frequency for this SSID in GHz

GetAvailableInterfaces.summary: Get device supported list of available interface including their state.

name.summary: Interface Name. ex: eth0 or wlan0

isEnabled.summary: Whether the interface is currently enabled

isConnected.summary: Whether the interface is currently connected

GetPrimaryInterface.summary: Gets the primary/default network interface for the device. The active network interface is defined as the one that can make requests to the external network. Returns one of the supported interfaces as per `GetAvailableInterfaces`, or an empty value which indicates that there is no default network interface.

SetPrimaryInterface.summary: Sets the primary/default interface for the device. This call fails if the interface is not enabled.

events.onActiveInterfaceChange: Triggered when device’s default interface changed.
events.onAddressChange: Triggered when the device connects to router.
events.onInternetStatusChange: Triggered when each IP address is lost or acquired.

GetIPSettings.summary: Gets the IP setting for the given interface.

SetIPSettings.summary: Sets the IP settings for the given interface.

events.onAddressChange: Triggered when the device connects to router.
events.onInternetStatusChange: Triggered when each IP address is lost or acquired.

GetStunEndpoint.summary: Get the STUN Endpoint that is used to identify public IP of the device.

SetStunEndpoint.summary: Set the STUN Endpoint to be used to identify public IP of the device.

GetConnectivityTestEndpoints.summary: Gets currently used test endpoints. on success list out the connectivity test points connections.

SetConnectivityTestEndpoints.summary: This method used to set up to 5 endpoints for a connectivity test. Successful connections are verified with HTTP Status code 204 (No Content).

endpoints.summary: A list of endpoints to test

IsConnectedToInternet.summary: Seeks Whether the device has internet connectivity. This API might take up to 3s to validate internet connectivity.

isConnectedToInternet.summary: `true` if internet connectivity is detected, otherwise `false`

GetCaptivePortalURI.summary: Gets the captive portal URI if connected to any captive portal network.

StartConnectivityMonitoring.summary: Enable a continuous monitoring of internet connectivity with heart beat interval thats given. If the monitoring is already happening, it will be restarted with new given interval.

events.onInternetStatusChange: Triggered when internet connection state changed.

GetPublicIP.summary: Gets the internet/public IP Address of the device.

publicIP.summary: Returns an public ip of the device

Ping.summary: Pings the specified endpoint with the specified number of packets.

tripMin.summary: The minimum amount of time to receive the packets

tripAvg.summary: The average time to receive the packets

tripMax.summary: The maximum amount of time to receive the packets

tripStdDev.summary: The standard deviation for the trip

Trace.summary: Traces the specified endpoint with the specified number of packets using `traceroute`.

onTraceResponse.onPingResponse: Triggered when Trace request get success.

tripMin.summary: The minimum amount of time to receive the packets

tripAvg.summary: The average time to receive the packets

tripMax.summary: The maximum amount of time to receive the packets

tripStdDev.summary: The standard deviation for the trip

StartWiFiScan.summary: Initiates WiFi scaning. This method supports scanning for specific range of frequency like 2.4GHz only or 5GHz only or 6GHz only or ALL. When no input passed about the frequency to be scanned, it scans for all. It publishes 'onAvailableSSIDs' event upon completion.

events.onAvailableSSIDs: Triggered when list of SSIDs is available after the scan completes.

frequency.summary: The frequency to scan. An empty or `null` value scans all frequencies. If a frequency is specified (2.4 or 5.0), then the results are only returned for matching frequencies.

StopWiFiScan.summary: Stops WiFi scanning. Any discovered SSIDs from the call to the `StartWiFiScan` method up to the point where this method is called are still returned as event.

GetKnownSSIDs.summary: Gets list of saved SSIDs. This method returns all the SSIDs that are saved as array.

AddToKnownSSIDs.summary: Saves the SSID, passphrase, and security mode for upcoming and future sessions. This method only adds to the persistent memory; does not disconnect from currently connected SSID.

RemoveKnownSSID.summary: Remove given SSID from saved SSIDs. This method just removes from the list and of the list is having only one entry thats being removed, it will initiate a disconnect.

events.onWiFiStateChange: Triggered when Wifi state changes to DISCONNECTED
events.onAddressChange: Triggered when an IP Address is assigned or lost
events.onInternetStatusChange: Triggered when internet connection state changed

WiFiConnect.summary: Initiates request to connect to the specified SSID with the given passphrase. Passphrase can be `null` when the network security is `NONE`. When called with no arguments, this method attempts to connect to the saved SSID and password. See `AddToKnownSSIDs`.

events.onWiFiStateChange: Triggered when Wifi state changes to CONNECTING, CONNECTED .

WiFiDisconnect.summary: Disconnects from the currently connected SSID. A event will be posted upon completion

events.onWIFIStateChange: Triggered when Wifi state changes to DISCONNECTED (only if currently connected).
events.onAddressChange: Triggered when an IP Address is assigned or lost
events.onInternetStatusChange: Triggered when internet connection state changed

securityMode.summary: The security mode. See the `connect` method

rate.summary: The physical data rate in Mbps

noise.summary: The average noise strength in dBm

StartWPS.summary:
Initiates a connection using Wifi Protected Setup (WPS). An existing connection will be disconnected before attempting to initiate a new connection. Failure in WPS pairing will trigger an error event.

If the `method` parameter is set to `SERIALIZED_PIN`, then RDK retrieves the serialized pin using the Manufacturer (MFR) API. If the `method` parameter is set to `PIN`, then RDK use the pin supplied as part of the request. If the `method` parameter is set to `PBC`, then RDK uses Push Button Configuration (PBC) to obtain the pin.

events.onWIFIStateChange: Triggered when Wifi state changes to DISCONNECTED (only if currently connected), CONNECTING, CONNECTED.
events.onAddressChange: Triggered when an IP Address is assigned or lost
events.onInternetStatusChange: Triggered when internet connection state changed

method.summary: The method used to obtain the pin (must be one of the following: PBC=0, PIN=1, SERIALIZED_PIN=2)

wps_pin.summary: A valid 8 digit WPS pin number. Use this parameter when the `method` parameter is set to `PIN`.

pin.summary: The WPS pin value. Valid only when `method` is set to `PIN` or `SERIALIZED_PIN`.

StopWPS.summary: Cancels the in-progress WPS pairing operation. The operation forcefully stops the in-progress pairing attempt and aborts the current scan. WPS pairing must be in-progress for the operation to succeed.

events.onWIFIStateChange: Triggered when Wifi state changes to DISCONNECTED.

events.onWiFiSignalStrengthChange: Triggered when Wifi signal strength switches between Excellent, Good, Fair, Weak.

GetSupportedSecurityModes.summary: Returns the Wifi security modes that the device supports.

security_modes.summary: The supported security modes and its associated integer value.

SetLogLevel.summary:
Set Log level for more information. The possible set log level are as follows. 
* `0`: FATAL  
* `1`: ERROR  
* `2`: WARNING  
* `3`: INFO 
* `4`: VERBOSE 
* `5`: TRACE

loglevel.summary: Set Log level to get more information

events.onInterfaceStateChange: Triggered when interface’s status changes to enabled.
Triggered when interface’s status changes to disabled.

GetWifiState.summary:
Returns the current Wifi State. The possible Wifi states are as follows.  
**Wifi States**  
* `0`: UNINSTALLED - The device was in an installed state and was uninstalled; or, the device does not have a Wifi radio installed   
* `1`: DISABLED - The device is installed but not yet enabled  
* `2`: DISCONNECTED - The device is installed and enabled, but not yet connected to a network  
* `3`: PAIRING - The device is in the process of pairing, but not yet connected to a network  
* `4`: CONNECTING - The device is attempting to connect to a network  
* `5`: CONNECTED - The device is successfully connected to a network  
* `6`: SSID_NOT_FOUND - The requested SSID to connect is not found 
* `7`: SSID_CHANGED - The device connected SSID is changed 
* `8`: CONNECTION_LOST - The device network connection is lost 
* `9`: CONNECTION_FAILED - The device connection got failed 
* `10`: CONNECTION_INTERRUPTED - The device connection is interrupted 
* `11`: INVALID_CREDENTIALS - The credentials provided to connect is not valid 
* `12`: AUTHENTICATION_FAILED - Authentication process as a whole could not be successfully completed 
* `13`: ERROR - The device has encountered an unrecoverable error with the Wifi adapter.

onInterfaceStateChange.summary:
Triggered when an interface state is changed. The possible states are 
* 'INTERFACE_ADDED' 
* 'INTERFACE_LINK_UP' 
* 'INTERFACE_LINK_DOWN' 
* 'INTERFACE_ACQUIRING_IP' 
* 'INTERFACE_REMOVED' 
* 'INTERFACE_DISABLED'

onAddressChange.summary: Triggered when an IP Address is assigned or lost.

isIPv6.summary: It will be true if the IP address is IPv6

ipAddress.summary: The IPv6 or IPv4 address for the interface

status.summary: Whether IP address was acquired or lost (must be one of the following: 'ACQUIRED', 'LOST')

onActiveInterfaceChange.summary: Triggered when the primary/active interface changes, regardless if it's from a system operation or through the `SetPrimaryInterface` method.

oldInterfaceName.summary: The previous interface that was changed

onInternetStatusChange.summary: Triggered when internet connection state changed.The possible internet connection status are `NO_INTERNET`, `LIMITED_INTERNET`, `CAPTIVE_PORTAL`, `FULLY_CONNECTED`

onAvailableSSIDs.summary: Triggered when scan completes or when scan cancelled.

onWiFiStateChange.summary:
Triggered when WIFI connection state get changed. The possible states are, 
 * '0' - 'WIFI_STATE_UNINSTALLED' 
 * '1' - 'WIFI_STATE_DISABLED' 
 * '2' - 'WIFI_STATE_DISCONNECTED' 
 * '3' - 'WIFI_STATE_PAIRING' 
 * '4' - 'WIFI_STATE_CONNECTING' 
 * '5' - 'WIFI_STATE_CONNECTED' 
 * '6' - 'WIFI_STATE_SSID_NOT_FOUND' 
 * '7' - 'WIFI_STATE_SSID_CHANGED' 
 * '8' - 'WIFI_STATE_CONNECTION_LOST' 
 * '9' - 'WIFI_STATE_CONNECTION_FAILED' 
 * '10'- 'WIFI_STATE_CONNECTION_INTERRUPTED' 
 * '11' - 'WIFI_STATE_INVALID_CREDENTIALS' 
 * '12' - 'WIFI_STATE_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED' 
 * '13' - 'WIFI_STATE_ERROR'

onWiFiSignalStrengthChange.summary: Triggered when WIFI connection Signal Strength get changed.
